guide.title: Gentoo Weekly Newsletter
guide.subtitle: 22 January 2007
guide.abstract: This is the Gentoo Weekly Newsletter for the week of 22 January 2007.

body.p: While (un)fortunately gnash (a FOSS flash implementation) is still in its infant shoes, Adobe released the final version of flash player 9 for linux. While the questions about why they didn't include a non-debug plugin into the -dev tarball, we just inserted the upstream version into the tree. (Thanks to Jakub Moc and Olivier Crete, for taking care of it so fast.)
Interview will be added soon. Looking for a decent picture ;-).

Alexander Færøy, a contributor at the paludis project, wrote a blogpost about their new asset, which is http://planet.paludis.org. For the people living under rocks, Paludis is an upcoming alternative to Portage written in C++, offering improved performance, a more flexible configuration system and providing many much-asked-for features that were unable to be added to the Portage. The paludis developers started the planet-integration which is updated each 30 minutes, to meet the needs from the quick-growing paludis community.

Because most of the Paludis developers are also Gentoo Developers (and because Paludis is a cool package manager), Danny Van Dyk will give a talk about this package manager at Fosdem2007. He'll be explaining how people can simplify maintaining packages within a basic gentoo installation.
